00020 
00021 //! A lightweight array for POD types. If the amount of memory requested is small, the stack is used.
00022 
00023 template<typename T1>
00024 class podarray
00025   {
00026   public:
00027   
00028   const u32       n_elem;    //!< number of elements held
00029         u32       pad;
00030   
00031   const T1* const mem;       //!< pointer to memory used by the object
00032   
00033   
00034   protected:
00035   
00036   T1 mem_local[ 128 / sizeof(T1) ];
00037   //!< Internal memory, allocated on the stack.
00038   //!< Designed to avoid calling the 'new' operator for small amounts of memory.
00039   
00040   
00041   public:
00042   
00043   inline ~podarray();
00044   inline podarray();
00045   
00046   inline podarray(const podarray& x);
00047   inline const podarray& operator=(const podarray& x);
00048   
00049   inline podarray(const u32 new_N);
00050 
00051   inline T1& operator[] (const u32 i);
00052   inline T1  operator[] (const u32 i) const;
00053   
00054   inline T1& operator() (const u32 i);
00055   inline T1  operator() (const u32 i) const;
00056 
00057   void set_size(const u32 new_n_elem);
00058   void fill(const T1 val);
00059 
00060   void zeros();
00061   void zeros(const u32 new_n_elem);
00062 
00063   inline T1* memptr();
00064   
00065   
00066   protected:
00067   
00068   inline void init(const u32 new_n_elem);
00069 
00070   };
00071 
00072 //! @}
